description: From Ottoman Turkish كاور‎ (gâvur), from Persian گاور‎ (gâvor), a variant of گبر‎ (gabr, “infidel”); see there for more. Doublet of Gheber.

entries.meaning: (religious slur) A non-Muslim, especially a Christian, an infidel; especially as used by Turkish people with particular reference to Christians such as Greeks, Armenians, Bulgarians, Serbs and Assyrians.
examples: We men are not a race of freebooters or giaours; not when our argosies are prey and food to the evil fish-of-metal whose lair is a German U-boat.
